metadata.title: CVE-2020-27066 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In xfrm6_tunnel_free_spi of net/ipv6/xfrm6_tunnel.c, there is a possibleuse after free due to improper locking. This could lead to local escalationof privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction isnot needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroidID: A-168043318

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27066` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-24-generic - 5.4.0-24.28
linux-image-5.4.0-24-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-24.28
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-24-generic - 5.4.0-24.28
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-24-lowlatency - 5.4.0-24.28
No subscription required
